dialogues.text: Emma stares at the screen: incredible.  Like a twin siste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of it as special assignment, Mrs. Peel.   With a twist. You're our chief suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying I have no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father will be your controller. Steed here  will show you the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very arch) Ropes?

dialogues.speaker: 55INT. SECRET SERVICE HQ SHOOTING GALLERY
dialogues.text: A life-size target of a man with blank face, bowler hat a flips up, and -- BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM!  Is riddled with holes by Emma, who works at reloading as

dialogues.speaker: 56HIGH ABOVE IN ONE-WAY MIRRORED GALLERY
dialogues.text: looking on, Mother with Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think she really killed those agents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She may not know. Theory goes she may be very ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amnesia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly. Split personality ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insane ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? If Dr. Darling is right,  you should watch out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She may try to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: 57IN SHOOTING GALLERY
dialogues.text: Emma swiftly turns, aims, and -- BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! FIRES with dead-eye p on target.  Steed reacts.  Ulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I ought to talk with Dr.  Darling.

dialogues.speaker: 58INT. SECRET SERVICE HQ PSY OPS ROOM
dialogues.text: A gallery of portraits of Emma Peel projected on the wall Warhol's Jackie (1964) -- Poignant, inscrutable, fascinat blown up, dissected, analyzed.  The swirling newspaper do Mother and Steed like bubbles from a light show. As DR. DARLING, head of the Ministry's Psychological Oper Ops) -- a kind of spy version of Timothy Leary, briefs th thick dark glasses and beard, Darling's obsessive interest in Emma adds a sinister air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One key point: Mrs. Peel is a widow: she's obsessively devoted to the memory  of her husband the scientist Peter Peel.  You may find her a little ... remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of Peter Peel on the wall.  Of Emma with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were a team. Met at Cambridge.  Working on a top secret research mission  into weather conditions, code name The Prospero Project, when Peel died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed looks meaningfully at Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something went wrong. System malfunction.   Explosion. Mrs. Peel had a narrow escape.   Suspected sabotage. Nothing proven. File  still open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you took so much interest in her, Dr. Darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her husband was one of ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes Peel's photo, then Mother) Peel? Did she know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still doesn't. Better safe than sorry.  She  was in a dangerous game, Steed. High  stakes. She may prove to be a risk.  If  she is, there's only one solution.  Termination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone particular in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Steed's reaction.  CLASHING BLADES OVER ...

dialogues.speaker: 59INT. SECRET SERVICE FENCING SALON
dialogues.text: Steed and Emma (new outfit), cross swords.  Like everythi does, Emma is a champion.  Steed is hard put.  Both fence cables -- very high-tech  dueling ... Steed is in white; Emma (natch), in black ... yin and yan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lady of hidden talents, Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tic-tac ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've no intention of hiding them ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tic-tac ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientist ... (tic-tac) ... marksman ... (tic-tac) ... swordsman ... (tic-tac) ... To what do you attribute your  overachievements?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast swordplay.  Tic-tac-tic-tac-tic.  Steed's good, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father always wanted a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  I fail to see the connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a feeling you would. Touche!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lunges; her foil tips right into the heart on Steed's Steed removes his mask; holds her foil tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take your point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma takes off her mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes indeed. I need protection.

dialogues.speaker: 60EXT. SIGN
dialogues.text: "Trubshaw's of Jermyn Street, since 1756."  Steed's Jag p -- of course there's a space.  Getting out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, absolutely, but Trubshaw's a man  worth meeting. No point setting out  half shod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) Or half cocked.

dialogues.speaker: 61CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: slips Steed's hand-made shoes an.  The "lasts" shapes of him -- bear Steed's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't agree more. Thank you,  Trubshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (significantly) Very good, Mr. Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: 62INT. TRUBSHAW'S GENTLEMEN'S SHOP
dialogues.text: A bull moose's antlers.  A horned rhino.  A Leopard.  A t next to them, in a wall of hunting trophies Emma paces im beneath them.  Shop assistants attend in tails and wing-c old school tie.  Steed emerges helped into a new flashy w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gags at the waistcoat) Steed, we really must be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relishing his shoes) Ahh. Perfect fit. The luxury of a  hand-made shoe. As unique as a face  or a fingerprint. Or should I say DNA?

dialogues.speaker: 63BEHIND DISPLAY
dialogues.text: Eyes watching Emma and Steed rise ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can but I wish you wouldn't ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Trubshaw ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A youngish man -- in black polo neck, Beatle-cut mop, pau smart suit, druggy high-pitched giggle.  BAILEY, a cocky, psychopath.  He watches Steed and Emma leave ... ... and saunters after them ...  CAR ROAR OVER.

dialogues.speaker: 64EXT. LONDON STREETS
dialogues.text: as the Jag races through them, heading for the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That place is so absurd, so out of date ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another car follows them ... as they pass Buckingham Pala painted pink and guarded by female grenadiers ...

dialogues.speaker: 65SIGN
dialogues.text: reading:  "Scotland" with an arrow, as Steed and Emma zoo Jag ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press that button, would you? Tea?

dialogues.speaker: 66CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: opens, revealing a tea service: a samovar of tea, feeding warmed pot, pouring into two china cups ... WIDEN to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: 67INT. JAG
dialogues.text: Emma, reacts, pours from the samovar ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Didn't mean to interrupt your flow of oratory ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed's JAG BACKFIRES again as at the beginning ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. This car -- and you. Nobody walks around like that. Milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all Tradition is bad, Mrs. Peel. No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands over a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? What's the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Gentleman has to have a code. This is part of mine. A uniform. Think of it as my suit of shining armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I suppose you're the knight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most unpredictable piece on the board. And always ready to protect his queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's predictable. When I find a queen in need of protection I'll let you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed looks in the mirror.  Behind them, a car.  Tailing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hoping you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his foot down.  Zoom ...

dialogues.speaker: 68EXT. COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: Towards picturesque Scotland.  The JAG ROARS by - then th ...

dialogues.speaker: 69INT. JAG
dialogues.text: Emma consults a list, reads --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir August Merryweather ... why are we seeing him first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As per mother's instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we always follow Mother's instructions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a man in my position --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what is your position, if you don't  mind my asking.  How did a stuffed  shirt like you get into this line of work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) They call me in when they've reached a  dead end. Freelance. Like yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no choice. Why should you risk your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After our fencing match, I was rather  hoping you would do the risking.   More tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma takes in Steed's evasive answers.  Sighing, she pour

dialogues.speaker: 70EXT. HIGHLANDS
dialogues.text: The Jag winds around Loch Ness, followed by the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to Mother, Sir August owns  half of the Highlands. A millionaire.   Former head of Special Projects at the  Ministry. Now ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eccentric recluse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so much eccentric. More barking  mad. He has a wife called June. And  a daughter somewhere -- Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June, July ... August?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family does seem to be somewhat  meteorologically inclined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any other vices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of a piece, really. A fanatical  weatherman. Chairman of BROLLY. (off her look) British Royal Organisation For Lasting Liquid Years. Thinks British  weather has been tampered with  by ... aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ... I distract him while you snoop  around? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small talk.  Try the weather.

dialogues.speaker: 72EXT. HUGE COUNTRY HOUSE
dialogues.text: Steed and Emma speed up to the huge open main gates Signs:  "Private: No Admittance."  Guards in hunting gear fours, with loaded rifles.  They start up the drive ... Several peacocks on the lawn fan open their beautiful tai One of them, a mechanical peacock whose thousand eyes CLI WHIR of a CAMERA ... The other car pulls in behind. Inside, reveal Bailey watc

dialogues.speaker: 73INT. MANOR HOUSE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: On a tartan carpet, a SCOTTIE BARKS furiously at a set of BAGPIPES on the floor.  PAN UP to reveal: A BUTLER leading Emma down the corridor -- -- where she admires the eccentric fixtures, pausing to n teddy bear outfit with tartan trimmings instead of the us armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Original ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, miss ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missus ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the double doors, admitting Emma into

dialogues.speaker: 74INT. A LARGE ROOM
dialogues.text: of semi-tropical climate.  Jungle plants, parakeets, snak lined with display cabinets and bell jars:  stuffed birds spiders.  A thermometer reads: 100 degrees with high humidity. The Butler leaves. Emma fans herself.  Nobody in the roam.  But hears a soun from a smoked glass conservatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir August ... ? Sir August ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh? In here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma follows the SOUND, steps cautiously forward.

dialogues.speaker: 75INT. CONSERVATORY
dialogues.text: beneath a sprinkler system of torrential rain, an old man bizarre rubber togs.  Emma stays cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come to apply for membership in Brolly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts above the tempest) You don't get rain like you used to in  England. A good shower that's the ticket.   Stiffens resolve, puckers the spirit, quells  the namby-pamby in a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIR AUGUST steps out of the shower and wind machine.  A b macintosh, flippers, goggles.  He starts to disrobe, the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I so agree. How did you acquire a  taste for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in India. So character-forming for the  British. Not the heat. Good Lord, no. The  rain, dash it. A good monsoon. Fifteen  inches overnight. A whole week of lovely  rain. I remember one summer in Jaipur ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir August removes his goggles, recognizes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you don't recall??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Emma can reply, the door opens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Lady June ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma's attention switches to LADY JUNE, a buxom lady in a and galoshes, who wheels in a tray of scones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear August.  Loves his showers. Like a baby. (beat) Scones, Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Lady -- June ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma sees Sir August gazing wistfully out of the window, rapidly  darkening ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, beautiful. Just as he promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promised? Who promised?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma looks, sees rain start to pitter-patter on the windo exchanges looks with June as the rain starts pouring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine being caught out in a blow  like that!

dialogues.speaker: 76EXT. MOORLAND
dialogues.text: THUNDER and lightning -- Steed is caught out in it; puts umbrella; wanders over the brow of a hill, past a big sig Trespassers."  Rains more.  And more. Turns to a tempest,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, this is a bit much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lashed by rain ' Steed carries on to the brow of the hill over, peers through the mist at -- A deep purple cloud.  Mushrooming towards him. Steed can't escape it.  It envelops him.  Starts to blink Footsteps less sure.  Surrounded by thick purple haze Steed stumbles and falls Down a hill.  Tumbles to the bottom.  He knocks his head Steed blinks, shakes his head.  Eyes refocus.  He sees

dialogues.speaker: 77UNDULATING SAND DUNES
dialogues.text: Sun shining down on yellow sand, a barren vista.  Dead tr Steed's in the Sahara.  A heat haze shimmers. Steed blinks, thinks he's dreaming when he sees ...

dialogues.speaker: 78IN DISTANCE
dialogues.text: Steed heads towards it.  The PHONE BOX seems further away optical illusion.  Then hears RINGING. Steed still bowler-hatted.  Overcoat.  Perspiring.  Takes wipes brow.  Adjusts rose in buttonhole.  It wilts. He arrives at the phone box. Opens the door.  Steed picks RINGING PHONE, listens to -- A SCRATCHY ORCHESTRAL RECORDING of "The Merry Widow."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The Merry Widow'...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the MUSIC, a strange --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) ... Hello ... Hello? ... Who the hell...? Who is this? ... You must leave the test area. I repeat, leave the area ... Help is on the way ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK.  The line goes dead.  Steed is baffled.  Steps out

dialogues.speaker: 79ON HORIZON
dialogues.text: a shimmering heat haze.  A figure on a camel moving towar Steed watches amazed, as the camel pads closer ... The mirage arrives. The rider dismounts. A woman in yashm She draws closer. Drops the veils to reveal -- Emma Peel.  In her black leather catsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peel. Good of you to drop by.  And I see you're wearing your -  riding outfit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma moves closer.  Steed smiles at her.  Emma closer and gives a kung-fu jab to the throat, a kick to the balls, a stomach.  As Steed lies on the  ground --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manners, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma takes out a .38 GUN, points at his heart, FIRES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The bullets strike his chest.  Round his heart.  Steed on the sands.  Eyes close ...

dialogues.speaker: 81EMMA
dialogues.text: moves over him. Drops a small toy snowshaker into his cur Blows a good-bye kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun.  Clouds roll by.  The camel peers down at him.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK.
dialogues.text: Sound of CLACKING ...

dialogues.speaker: 83INT. SECRET SERVICE HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: A hospital ward.  Empty apart from one bed.  A nurse (Bre leather), her spiked heels clacking on the floor, brings tea to Steed in a hospital bed.  Who wakes, surprised to see Emm over him.  Very nonchalant.  Eating his grapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Brenda ... (as she leaves) Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be dead.  How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes her) Strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were very lucky.  Four shots to  the heart. I found you after I slipped  away from Sir August. Mother brought  you here. Not me you should thank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't about to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean your man Trubshaw.  Your bullet-proof waistcoat.  I thought  you were just overdressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might say the same.

dialogues.speaker: 84FROM GALLERY
dialogues.text: Mother with Dr. Darling taking notes.  Emma looks up at t a whisper.  But they both are wearing headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and Dr. Darling have me  under observation. They think I  tried to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should they think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told them. You said I arrived  on a camel, shot you four times.  Left you for dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly that's how I remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's absurd. I may not be  over-fond of you, Steed, but it's  not my style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps your memory plays tricks, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conceding) That's possible. Sir August was convinced  he'd met me before. But I'd never met him.   Another odd thing. When it rained, he said  it was just as someone had promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But he must know. Incidentally,  my double left you with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma shows Steed the toy snow scene.  A winter wonderland He looks puzzlingly at it.  On its underneath. "The Wonde Corporation," followed by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An invitation. To a 'formal picnic'...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say formal? I must dress.

dialogues.speaker: 85EXT. LONDON STREET
dialogues.text: The sporty Jag pulls up outside a tall, swanky building. out, opens her door. Irritated, Emma steps out of the car leather suit --

dialogues.speaker: 86CLOSEUP OF HER HEEL
dialogues.text: hitting the street.   PAN UP TO Steed, admiring --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must say, you look more your old self --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean my other self ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way ... may I ask: why you dress in that fashion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have thought that was obvious ... (off his smirk) I'm in mourning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves off.  Stay on his poker face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to see afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He joins her; they survey the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the picnic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up to --

dialogues.speaker: 87INT. CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: A boardroom suite, overlooking London.  Lights twinkling Around a conference table.  Twelve TEDDY BEARS.  Each six Ridiculous and sinister.  In pink, turquoise, brown, blac green.  Furry, giant paws and ears, swivel eyes.  One ted familiar tartan ... On the table, children's party food: jellies, hundreds an birthday cakes.  And wrapped presents before each. Each bear has a name-badge: Bobby, Bobo, Bruno, Bibi, Bet pinned to their fur.  A children's tune, "THE TEDDY BEAR' plays.  Followed by - a gavel rapping order. A distinctively chilling voice, eerily familiar and seduc ECHOES through our story --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Ladies, gentlemen and bears ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teddy bears look round.  Can't hear who's talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Today is history. The first day of the future.  I welcome you to the first general meeting  of the Wonderland Corporation, now allied  with our colleagues from Brolly ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murmurs of congratulations amongst the bears ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) You have all given time, money and expertise  to achieve our goal. But we are reaching a  new phase of our operation. From today,  many of you will no longer be needed. I have  to warn you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dismay from the teddy bears.  As a CUCKOO CLOCK RINGS OUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) A cuckoo.  The first sign of spring, and ...  A cuckoo in our nest. Our organization is  no longer secret. Agents are investigating  us. Their names are John Steed and Emma  Peel. I believe we have a traitor among us  ... perhaps more than one ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uproar from the teddy bears.  Shouts of "Who?" (*PS: One is a giant rabbit who seems especially alarmed).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) That remains to be seen. When we find  the traitors, they will be dealt with severely. TEDDY BEAR #l These agents.  Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Here. In this building. By our estimate, they  will enter this room in thirty-five point five  seconds precisely ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panic.  The bears scramble to go, bumping into each other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I am sorry the party is over.  But we  shall meet again. To each of you a gift. A token of my appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the teddy bears, each one receives a present paper with a pink and silver bow. The tartan teddy opens his up:  A snow scene.  Anxious mo

dialogues.speaker: 88INT. BUILDING
dialogues.text: UP and inside fire staircase, Emma and Steed run up -- Op the conference room.  The CUCKOO RINGS on their entry.  T empty room. Only the party detritus plus little teddy bea where formerly the big ones sat; the teddy bear picnic MU again OVER ... One snow shaker left.  Steed picks it up:  Inside it:

dialogues.speaker: 89TINY EMMA PEEL
dialogues.text: in black leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: 90BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Emma stares at it.  Turns it over:  an address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another invitation. 38 Marlborough Terrace ...

dialogues.speaker: 91INT. EMBASSY, (BELGRAVIA)
dialogues.text: Inside number 38, a deserted Eastern bloc embassy.  A dil hammer and sickle tapestry in tatters.  Old spy techno-ju discarded in elegant living rooms. Steed and Emma open the door, rush inside. They search for clues.  A cigar left in an ashtray.  Stee with distaste.  Then moves over to the wine rack, picks u bottle of champagne --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (admiringly) Hm ... A Veuve-Cliquot '56 ... (then puzzled) But he bites the end of his Monte Cristos ... ? (frowning) Clearly, we're dealing with a maniac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Emma goes into the --

dialogues.speaker: 92NEXT ROOM
dialogues.text: where she sees a blob of BUBBLING GUNK, like radioactive A few pieces of charred clothing tell us this was once a bear outfit.

dialogues.speaker: 93BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Steed enters behind her, examines the gunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

The "double" attacks.  Emma retaliate Kicks up her leg -- flings the "double" over her head she awkwardly -- a METALLIC CRUNCH in a blow to her head -- b herself up without pausing And vanishes into the rooftop maze.

Misses, then grabs hold, and CABLE -- a thousand VOLTS surge through her body -- -- A shock, Emma plummets DOWN TO --

dialogues.text: Thanks ... (dry) I see what you mean about letting me do the risking ... Hello?

dialogues.text: A cyclone hit Banffshire last night. Completely unpredicted ...

dialogues.text: Where's Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mobile HQ. In a blue funk.  Can't  take chances. I'm looking after  things while he's hiding out ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father drives like a maniac.  She senses their unease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably wondering how I  can drive 'blind.' Simple. A new  prototype from the boys in X division.   Micro-sensors in the system read  signals and road information. Converts  the info into miles per hour.  Ultra-sensitive.  Ultra-smart.

dialogues.text: Father jumps a red light.  CARS SCREECH together in a hug Not that smart.  Steed holds onto his hat.

dialogues.text: So you say ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: But

dialogues.text: Fares, please,

dialogues.text: is Mother's temporary mobile HQ.  He squats in a corner. on electronic panels.  Now paranoid.  Suspicious.  All th windows have been blacked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to mobile H.Q. Weather's  turning quite nasty. Sir August was  blown to smithereens. Along with  half of Banffshire.  The Ministry's  worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to warn us ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a lead to Wonderland Weather but we got there too late. Someone tipped them off ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late anyway. Today's escapade  was only for starters. This is no  ordinary weather. It's manmade. A  kind of weather bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite. This is my field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything that isn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores) The Prospero Project was started by  my husband. It was an early attempt  to solve the problems of global warming.   In theory, climate engineering is entirely  feasible. We thought of injecting a  chemical cocktail into the atmosphere  by laser and satellite. A 'quick fix'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filling in mother nature's blind spots ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. There'd been earlier attempts  to pump carbon dioxide into deep sea.   Propane gas mostly. In small quantities  it captures chlorine. Protects the ozone  layer. But it proved impractical.  Too bulky ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if someone miniaturized the process...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we were working on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds as if someone's hijacked your research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be possible to use it for military purposes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directed by laser. Bounced by satellite. Quite possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would they aim for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother thinks, gets out of his wheelchair; takes a turn a sits down again.  No one pays any attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: London. The World Council of Ministers  meets soon on global defence. If you can  control the weather, you control the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the cold war ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hot and cold war ...

dialogues.text: Sign "Grand Opening Soon."  WIDEN to reveal ...

The natural b Wonderland Weather." Steed reacts; the model is the same as Emma on the big ne Harrods ... Steed finds a desk.  Inspects papers.  Sees a postcard of stately home.  He pockets it.  Then looks 'round to see - Bailey before him.  We recognize him as the young dandy t Neither gives away the other.

dialogues.text: We're not yet open for business, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame. I was recommended. By a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir August Merryweather? I was looking for something relaxing. Say, a Tuscan hillside in June?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally, we'd be eager to oblige --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Natural weather delivered to your door on demand. Down your phoneline. For limited periods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't say. How real does it feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As real as you wish. Hot or cold. Humid or dry. Anything you like. Within reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are limits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The technology is brand new. Soon  it will be more powerful. We  anticipate a huge demand. Leave us  your number. We'll be in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need. I'll call again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed raises his bowler.  Bailey watches him go.

dialogues.text: My car. I'll drive.

dialogues.text: Emma's LOTUS ELAN WHIZZES BY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A day in the country ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three agents killed by bad weather...

dialogues.text: ... And by you, Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores) Then a mad millionaire. Head of a secret  defense establishment. A group of  eccentrics obsessed by weather ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And by you, Mrs. Peel. Everything  points to you.  No sisters?  No  undiscovered twin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I know of.  Explanation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to Dr. Darling, you're a  psychopathic personality with  schizophrenic delusions, suffering from  recurring amnesia based on traumatic  repression, leading to outbursts of  anti-social and violent behavior.  Q.E.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well ... (beat) Just my type, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear --

dialogues.text: Cocky little bastard. I hope he was a baddy.

dialogues.text: I feel sure of it.

dialogues.text: I'm Alice. Mother said you'd be on your way. Mrs. Peel with you?

dialogues.text: (looks around) She was ...

dialogues.text: (not paying attention) You don't say. (mumbles) Like looking for a needle in a ...

dialogues.text: What, Lady Disdain? Are you yet breathing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will let me know if you find that queen who's in need of protection, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her out.  She's annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: 143OUTSIDE HAYSTACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding it ruefully) This must be the last straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes one off her back) Here's the one that broke the camel's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone didn't want us to get to the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect we'll have to gatecrash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may be able to help you.

dialogues.text: comes to life.  Steed, Emma and the Old Lady survey ...

dialogues.text: Mrs. Peel ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed hears a noise, turns to see -- Emma walking towards him.  She picks the rose from his la coils an arm around his neck.  Pulls Steed towards her, c -- kisses him full an the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peel ... ! (more kiss) Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kiss ends.  Steed recovers his composure, lips coated lipstick.  His tongue traces his lips; smarts ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lipstick ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poison.  He goes dizzy.  Steed collapses to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: 153INT. HALLUCINOGEN HALL
dialogues.text: Inside the house, a grand hall.  Deserted.  A cobweb hang ceiling.  A velvet curtain tattered and torn. Emma. A CUCKOO CLOCK RINGS the hour.  Ahead, the real Emma sees A giant staircase.  There on the stairs -- a glass eye. She picks it up.  Puts it in a pocket.  Emma goes --

dialogues.speaker: 154UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Sees a series of family portraits an the staircase.  One ornate aristocratic regalia.

dialogues.speaker: 155LONG CORRIDOR UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Rooms on either side.  Emma goes down the hall, pushes do

dialogues.speaker: 156INSIDE ROOMS
dialogues.text: A mad child's collections of ... toys... rocking horses . ... ventriloquists' dummies... and ... Butterflies ... scarabs ... beetles ... glass eyes, stari the blackness ... Then Emma turns into a whole room of ... Snow shakers ... A wall of them in glass cabinets like in or fossils.  Emma picks up one snow scene. She shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: 157EXT. HOUSE
dialogues.text: as if in response, a storm gathers.  Shadowy clouds roll

dialogues.speaker: 158IN MAZE
dialogues.text: A drop of rain starts to fall.  Steed's eyes flicker open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: rain) Not again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises, looks down, reacts -- Alice, the Old Lady, lies near him in the maze, her neck Steed kneels, next to her in the rain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trap. Tell Mother, beware. Tell Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dies in his arms. Wind picks up, too. Steed looks about, frowning with discouragement --

dialogues.speaker: 159INT. HALLUCINOGEN HALL PLAYROOM
dialogues.text: THUNDER and lightning outside.  Inside the room of snow s CHILDHOOD TUNE PLAYS.  Emma shakes the snow scene.  The w to grow darker.

dialogues.speaker: 160FROM BEHIND
dialogues.text: Emma hears the unmistakable chilling voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't shake that too hard. The weather might turn nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the shadows ... a man.  A silhouette.  Behind a dist His shape and face unclear.  Emma puts down the shaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If nature gives a man a collector's mind,  it doesn't matter what he collects.   Butterflies. Old China. Penny farthings.  A true collector grows more obsessive  as the years pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the big window the weather is turning nasty ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your voice -- it's so familiar ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have met ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the shadows, a man moves out, revealing: Peter Peel, Emma's husband!  THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instinctively Emma moves towards him.  A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be dreaming ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma pulls back.  Before she can turn, Peter takes her ha over his heart.  BA-BOOM, BA-BOOM, BA-BOOM ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... Very much alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter touches her hand.  Emma looks into his eyes.  Intri alarmed, disbelief.  Peter raises her hand to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, it's me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma shudders, battles with herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is tempted, yet filled with terror.

dialogues.speaker: 161CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: Inside her pupil --

dialogues.speaker: 162MEMORY FLASHES
dialogues.text: His face as he kissed her -- his ring on her finger -the -- the glass obscuring his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible ... how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter smiles disarmingly.  As if the answer was obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you ... all for you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter comes over, folds her in his arms.  Takes her head hands.  Emma leans over to him, about to kiss him, both c eyes, until -- Lips parted.  Before they kiss, Emma pulls back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, runs to the door.  Like a trapped bird.  She t -- locked.  Another door -- locked.  A window -- locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't run away. I forgive you,  Emma. I know you left me. But  I still love you. Do you still have  my ring? I need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter grabs hold of Emma.  She pulls away.  Emma sees his her, pleading with her.  Seductive yet nightmarish. As if hallucinating, Emma runs away, towards -- The big window overlooking the gardens.  She runs, leaps,

dialogues.speaker: MOTION --
dialogues.text: Crashes thru the GLASS, shards and splinters SHATTERING a as she --

dialogues.speaker: 164EXT. HALLUCINOGEN HALL
dialogues.text: somersaults through the window down to the ground.  Lands on the wet ground.  Looks up to see -- Steed above her, the STORM RAGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles to her feet, comes towards him, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. First time, shame on you. Third time, shame on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slugs her and the SCREEN GOES BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diagnosis confirmed.  Mrs. Peel is  suffering from delusions and  hallucinations. An extreme personality  disorder. She imagines her husband  Peter Peel has come back to her ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Emma's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A classic syndrome, to overcome her  subconscious guilt at her other crimes.   We've attached her to the dreamscape  machine. We'll soon see what her  unconscious looks like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma's eyes flicker... Steed comes INTO FOCUS, sitting by Emma's bed.  This time her grapes ... Emma looks around ... Everything blurs.  A STEADY PULSE D leather straps.  No use.  WIDEN to reveal Emma strapped t couch -- Her head surrounded by a plastic dome, terminals and wire into a Dreamscape machine.  Drowsy, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Winslow Home for Retired Lepidoptorists. I'm so sorry I struck you, Mrs. Peel. Please forgive me. I thought you were someone else ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no smile) I expect that's for you to know and me to find out ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Peter -- I saw him ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugged, Emma's eyes drop.  FOCUS CHANGES TO --

dialogues.speaker: 165ABOVE HER
dialogues.text: A giant spiral HYPNODISC WHIRRS, creating trippy black an zag op-art effects a la Bridget Riley. She blinks.

dialogues.speaker: 166SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Steed is gone.  Dr. Darling leans over her.  Emma stares hypnodisc.  Closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HER EYES
dialogues.text: Thousand REMs per sec -- a tiny chip next to her eyes, tr via wires to --

dialogues.speaker: 168UP ON WALL
dialogues.text: A "Dreamscape" apparatus like a liquid TV screen flicks t images from Emma's unconscious.  Peter Peel -- Teddy Bear views -- childhood  snaps --

dialogues.speaker: 169BESIDE "BED"
dialogues.text: Dr. Darling furls his hand over Emma's, his fingers resti ring.  During the interrogation, he soothingly strokes he tries to remove the ring without arousing her suspicion. on it.

dialogues.speaker: 170UP IN GALLERY
dialogues.text: In his wheelchair, Mother sits beside Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man -- did you see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Her husband, she says. Alice tried to warn us. A trap. Tell Mother beware. Tell Father That's all.

dialogues.speaker: 171BY COUCH
dialogues.text: Dr. Darling leans forward to interrogate Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks and sounds sinister.  From a corner of her eye, clip of keys hanging from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to say the first thing that comes into your head when I say these words. Do you understand ... ? (as she nods) Blue ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... bottle ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... head ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knight ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... death ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... death ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed watching, listening ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flower ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... power ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exchange speeds up.  Unknown to Dr. Darling, Emma pic unlocks her straps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nature ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... preserve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... love ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... love ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Emma talks, the "Dreamscape" plucks images from her un trippy psychedelic rush:  faces -- colors -- patterns fla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Piper picked a peck of pickled  peppers how many pecks of pickled  peppers did Peter Peel -- ?

dialogues.speaker: 174CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: Quietly unclicks a lock.  She stops in mid-gabble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have I been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma unlocks her straps.  Sits Up.  Woozy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you get paid by the hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Darling is shocked, indignant.  Emma rips wires from "Dreamscape" machine winds down.  Up in the gallery -- BAM -- !  Mother bashes his metal cane on the railings

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) You are here under observation,  Mrs. Peel. You must answer Dr.  Darling's questions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushes Dr. Darling aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I resign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) You need treatment, Mrs. Peel.  You can't resign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma staggers.  Mother looks at Steed.  Who snaps himself staring at the hypnodisc. Emma heads for the airlock door marked:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't open that, Mrs. Peel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat chance ... she goes in ...

dialogues.speaker: 175INT. ANTI-GRAVITY CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Emma floats in the air, as Mother, Dr. Darling and Steed And float helplessly, turning around madly.  Trying to ga Mother's wheelchair, Steed's umbrella and bowler, all tum air as Steed tries to reach the "OFF" switch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echoing) What are you trying to do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flailing) We want to help...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was a widow. My husband ... the only man I ever loved ... is dead. For the rest of my life I have to live with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The death of Peter Peel was a great loss. To us all ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother looks at Emma.  He's let the cat out the bag.  Ste "OFF" switch. They all tumble to the floor, Mother landin his wheelchair, Steed effortlessly catching his hat and umbrella.  He mov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you owe Mrs. Peel an explanation ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed stares Mother out.  Who delivers his revelations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter Peel was a first class agent. A senior operative. 'X' department Special operations.   He was engaged in top secret research.   Top priority.  Government approved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Institute ... the funding ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cover ... for us. (beat) I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A turning moment for Emma.  A life lived on a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So all that time. Our work, our research  was for you ... for this? And the  accident --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was no accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The official investigation ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... was written by me. (beat) It was sabotage, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deadly serious, Emma walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite frankly ... it could have been you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  Emma looks away, shocked.  Steed intervenes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're accusing Mrs. Peel of killing her own husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her husband suspected someone very  close to the operation. On the day he  died, he was setting a test. To prove to himself -- to us that his  wife was beyond suspicion. He had to  be certain. He said he was going to  give Mrs. Peel something ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma keeps staring at Mother, fingers her diamond ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I want you to remember. Did Peter give you anything on-that  day?

dialogues.speaker: 176CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: touches her ring.

dialogues.speaker: 177BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Emma looks up at Mother.  A barefaced lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed notices Emma touch her ring nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said if it vanished, he'd know it was ... you who betrayed him. He took a huge risk. The ultimate test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm still ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under suspicion. Everyone died in  the explosion, Mrs. Peel. You were  the only survivor ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother waits.  Emma turns round.  Looks fiercely at him. uneasily as Emma walks past him to the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an official matter, Mrs. Peel. No need to take it personally. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find out who killed my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors and walls are monitored,  Mrs. Peel. This is a very secure  establishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma pushes open the doors.  Walks out.  Down a corridor. grabs Mother, as he exits with Steed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must remain here. She's highly dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: 178IN HALL
dialogues.text: Mother exits with Steed; they watch Emma going ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity. I was growing fond of Mrs. Peel. Unfortunately --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty until proven innocent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and Father know best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother wheels himself off.  Then stops; over his shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something quick. Nothing too ... messy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Steed.  CAR ROAR over as --

dialogues.speaker: 179EXT. COUNTRYSIDE CLINIC
dialogues.text: Emma drives a hot-wired Morris Minor out the open gates o house, past a sign which reads: "WINSLOW HOME FOR RETIRED LEPIDOPTORISTS" (Butterfly logo In the b.g., a couple of old-timers race around with butt Steed's jag pulls past them in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: 180EXT. COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: Emma speeds down lanes ... Followed at a safe distance by Steed in his SS100.

dialogues.speaker: 181INT. STEED'S JAG
dialogues.text: Steed looks: a bleep on his radar screen tracks the --

dialogues.speaker: 182CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: on Emma's shoulder as she drives ...

dialogues.speaker: 183EXT. LANES
dialogues.text: The cars whiz past ...

dialogues.speaker: 184INT. STEED'S JAG
dialogues.text: Keeping an eye on his radar and the road, Steed switches The weather forecast:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) '... Sunny intervals leading to sudden storms and gale warnings for all areas. (as he frowns) ... Outbursts of rain, scattered hailstorms and freezing fog greeted the World Council of Ministers as they arrived in London for their conference ...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma drives into a churchyard.  Steed follows her ...

dialogues.speaker: 185INT. COUNTRY CHURCH
dialogues.text: A medieval country church.  Sunlight streams through stai illumining Emma as Steed watches her lay -- A red rose by an altar tomb:  an ornate mausoleum two han a pose of eternal sleep:  Peter Peel. Emma pauses, as in the b.g., choirboys sing hymn practice watches Emma move away, toward the door.  He drops a hymn swivels round -- sees Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You followed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fractional pause) Nothing personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma smiles. Then turns, and -- Runs!  Steed follows Emma through a door to --

dialogues.speaker: 186INT. CHURCH BELL TOWER
dialogues.text: Steed enters, glimpses -- Emma above.  He follows her.  Hears her footsteps.  Trip- the spiral staircase.  Steed listens, follows.

dialogues.speaker: 187UP BELLTOWER
dialogues.text: From below, Steed hears a BELL RING.  A FLUTTER of BIRDS. falls down -- Steed runs up stairs, reaches --

dialogues.speaker: 188EXT. BELLTOWER TOP
dialogues.text: BELL still RINGING.  At the top, a sheer drop.  Steed edg the ledge.  Looks.  A long way down. From behind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed swivels.  Sees Emma blocking his path.  Cool menace away from the edge, Emma circles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. You might fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma steps to the edge.  Steed freezes.  Emma locks down. on the ledge.  Rocking to and fro ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could save you the trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you always obey orders ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always. (pause) Except ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed nears her.  Emma pushes herself right to the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... when I don't. It comes down to one  thing, Mrs. Peel. Trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed reaches out for her.  Holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be convinced, if ... I knew who  poisoned me in the maze. That kiss ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me; you have my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed snatches her from the edge, holds her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma thinks.  Looks at him.  Deadly serious.  Their eyes hesitates, then pecks him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was longer. On the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma hesitates.  Then a kiss on the lips.  Longer.  But n Steed grabs her hand, pulls her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much longer.  Approximately ... fifteen seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma harumphs, exasperated.  Moves closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed nods.  Emma leans forward.  A full kiss.  At first Emma looks at her watch.  Counts seconds ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Four ... seven ... ni-...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then ... forgets.  Warmer, more relenting.  Edging toward They stay embracing for fifteen seconds ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aroused) Mmm ... what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping a stiff upper lip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kiss continues couple of seconds longer.  Before Emma With an effort, she regains her composure.  A long silenc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm in the clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed savors the kiss.  No reply.  His smile says it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you did suspect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're playing games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't we all, Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you played by the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm playing to win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winning isn't everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't tell me it's how you play the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles; stands aside) After you -- Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed motions down the stairs.  It's close to the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to square one) You don't trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as you trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma motions.  Steed goes down, passes close to the edge, round nervously.  Emma reads his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it happens, Steed, you'll be the first to know ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this comforting thought, Steed descends first.

dialogues.speaker: 189EXT. CHURCH TOWER
dialogues.text: As Steed and Emma exit from the tower, they see -- A tranquil village scene.  Choirboys walk out from the ch in the deserted village street.  A red PHONE BOX.  Which RING-RING ... Starts to RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROLL of THUNDER.  Steed looks up: a clear sky.  He's pu Suddenly suspicious.  As Emma moves to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- don't answer it ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her back.  Emma looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. The phones trigger the explosions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING-RING ... Another ROLL of THUNDER.  Steed connects th angelic CHOIRBOY walks towards the phone ... RING-RING ... A LOUDER ROLL of THUNDER.  As the Choirboy PHONE, Steed shouts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't -- don't answer it -- !

dialogues.speaker: 190CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: RING-RING -- the PHONE in the f.g. as the choirboy closes door --

dialogues.speaker: 191INSIDE PHONE BOX
dialogues.text: The door shuts.  Noise muffled.  The Choirboy can't hear Emma's shouted warnings, as he lifts his hand up, and --

dialogues.speaker: 192OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Steed sees him reach out, warns the vicar and choirboys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down -- get down -- it's going to explode -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed and Emma, all the choirboys hit the dirt, as

dialogues.speaker: 193INSIDE PHONE BOX
dialogues.text: The Choirboy grabs the phone, and lifts it up, and Silence. No explosion.  A few seconds pass.  Steed and everyone are down on the ground.  As they see --

dialogues.speaker: 194FROM PHONE BOX
dialogues.text: -- the Choirboy leaves the phone hanging.  He gets out, s crowd.  Then walks calmly over to Steed, who's still pron

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vicar and choirboys look on sympathetically, as -- Steed dusts himself off.  Emma and everyone gets up.  Ste phone box, takes the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother? How did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His expression changes as he listens.  Emma goes to the p Steed rings off. He emerges from the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Mother I took care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I equivocated. But you're not their big worry at present. It's Dr. Darling:  he's disappeared ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Emma's reaction to this news --

dialogues.speaker: 195INT. HALLUCINOGEN HALL
dialogues.text: Inside the upper room, in front of a mirror -- With his back turned to us.  Dr. Darling holds something and waits as --

dialogues.speaker: 196DOWN LONG HALL
dialogues.text: Bad "Emma" walks over.  She stands in front of him. Blank expression.  Dr. Darling hardly even looks up.  Wit we recognize on her neck a tattoo:  Z424.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in the final phase. I shall require  you to be especially obedient. There  must be no failures.

dialogues.speaker: 197CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: which he grips tightly. As --

dialogues.speaker: 198IN MIRROR
dialogues.text: a metamorphosis.  His features melt and bubble, a mask of surgery and it's slipping around like Michael Jackson's f kleig lights.  He adjusts it, then ... Shakes the snowshaker ...

dialogues.speaker: 199EXT. COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: THUNDER as the sky darkens -- PAN DOWN to reveal: Steed's Jag, zooming through country lanes.  Rain starts.

dialogues.speaker: 200INT. JAG
dialogues.text: Steed driving, winces with the drizzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drat. Someone wants to implicate you in this affair, Mrs. Peel. Any idea who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea who. No idea why ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) Teddy bears, cuckoo clocks, toys All children's things ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Or grown-ups, who still like to be children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite. Any childhood friends? Enemies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to speak of. Peter and I were both loners. There was nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed thinks; sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. I have a friend who might be of assistance. He's at the Ministry. We'd better be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a wanted woman, I know ...

dialogues.speaker: 201INT. MINISTRY CORRIDORS
dialogues.text: Through a door marked "Information & Counter Espionage" - -- walks Steed with another man in identical clothes:  da Row suit, umbrella and bowler.  Which is Emma Peel, in disguise.  Steed furtively checks passers-b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Jones. 'Invisible' Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's he called 'Invisible'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a door marked "Information -- Col. I. Jones." Steed kn the door for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch you up. Don't worry; he's expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma goes in as Steed walks down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: 202INT. MINISTRY OFFICE
dialogues.text: A room full of archives and files.  Emma walks through ta stacks of cabinets full of old paper. Dusty, musty and mildewing.  Long forgotten.  Nobody ther Emma  hears -- FOOTSTEPS. She follows them.  Round stacks, round corners.  The FOOT LOUDER.  She's closing in.  The FOOTSTEPS get LOUDER, unt her -- A filing cabinet drawer opens up.  On its own. Emma watches as a file pops up, floats through air.  The shut.  Still nobody there.  Emma follows the file to a -- Desk.  Emma watches as -- the chair swivels round.  The f up.  Then the phone lifts up by itself, a voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Miss Proudfoot, no calls. (beat) Colonel Jones at your service, Mrs. Peel. Just a moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma looks ahead of her.  To the chair. As -- A desk drawer opens up, a pipe is whisked through the air struck.  The pipe lights; smoke belches forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to the pipe, Mrs. Peel. That usually helps. Don't worry about me being invisible. Other than that I'm perfectly normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or rather, you don't. Learnt the tricks in camouflage. Till this accident made a prang of things. How can I help you, Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: 203INT. MINISTRY
dialogues.text: Steed on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, Trubshaw, Steed here ... Barometer's falling fast. Mrs. Peel and I find ourselves in need of foul weather gear. (beat) Yes, I'd say gentlemen's snuff for starters. And then --

dialogues.speaker: 204INT. INVISIBLE JONES' OFFICE
dialogues.text: File pages flip through the air as Jones goes through the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, here we are. Steed asked me to play a hunch:  Valentine Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's brother?  But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-brother to be precise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's see ... Eton, Cambridge ...  research into robotics and plastics.   Overtaken by Peter's work on the  physics of climate change ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you also know that during your  final experiment, your halfbrother- in-law was under surveillance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surveillance? By whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father. She gave him an 'all clear'  after a security test by Dr. Darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's now vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes two of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting that Dr. Darling  and Valentine were somehow in this  together? But that's absurd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed enters behind them on the run --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must hurry, Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry?  What for?  I'm just now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) I was getting to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The World Council of Ministers meets  tomorrow to convene the new global  defense initiative --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fail to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a reception this evening. Colonel  Jones thinks it advisable we attend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we been invited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (poker-voiced) Under the circumstances Mother didn't  see fit, but I think I can get you in ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surveys her male outfit) Well, I can't possibly go like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a feeling. That's why we're  in a hurry ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed proffers an arm to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have the honor, Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She decides, takes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may, Mr. Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The A-team is born.  Steed and Emma tip their hats to Jon

dialogues.speaker: 205EXT. LONDON STREETS
dialogues.text: Troops rushing in to take up defense positions.  Searchli the cloudy sky.  A protective ring of hardware surrounds

dialogues.speaker: 206INT. MOTHER'S 22 BUS, (AKA INSIDE MOBILE HQ)
dialogues.text: At the controls, Brenda looks on.  She hands a bag of jel Mother.  Who picks out his favorites, as he gives a brief and others, sitting in passenger seats -- ORDERS BARKED OUTSIDE as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside that hall are some of the Most powerful figures in the world. Tight security. Our only option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see to it personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda glances over at Father's imperturbable face. As --

dialogues.speaker: 207EXT. PALACE, (WESTMINSTER)
dialogues.text: Wind picking up.  Outside the grand palace hall for the r the World Council of Ministers, guards stand on duty.  Ba flashing lights.  Nobody gets past,  except --

dialogues.speaker: 208INT. PALACE, (WESTMINSTER)
dialogues.text: Up in the gallery, Steed and Emma enter through a secret a painting.  He with bowler and umbrella.  She in black l boots.  They find themselves in a niche and freeze, very close to one another.  Steed sni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that you're wearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called Black Leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intoxicating. Here, have one of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fumbles with a bulging jacket pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limpet bomb. Small, very compact. From Trubshaw's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hocks it on belt) When all this is over, we simply must get you out of that suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads the way through marble halls, arched galleries, carpets, glittering chandeliers.  From the hall, a SPEECH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... In the uncertain climate that threatens  this global initiative, no magic umbrella  can shield us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed checks out his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only our own vigilance. Security and  stability are our watchwords.

dialogues.speaker: APPLAUSE.
dialogues.text: Steed pauses, offers Emma a small silver box.  Inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trubshaw again? What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snuff. (off Emma's lock) I must insist you try some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed takes some; Emma follows his example.  Weird.  Does high?  They walk on, open doors to --

dialogues.speaker: 209INT. PALACE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: An empty gallery.  Steed and Emma peer down at a --

dialogues.speaker: 210MARBLE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: A black and white floor.  Butlers move across like surrea pieces.  Otherwise, empty.  A chamber ensemble plays "The waltz, which floats through empty halls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're playing your song, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) 'The Merry Widow?' I might have known. Where's the reception?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move cautiously forward as

dialogues.speaker: 211EXT. LONDON STREETS
dialogues.text: Outside, snow begins to fall.  Trees and buildings shimme light layer of white.  A Christmassy glow -- Even troops play with snowflakes, until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind rises.  The snow falls harder.

dialogues.speaker: 213INT. PALACE
dialogues.text: Down in the hallway, Steed and Emma search for the Minist head down a  corridor, then hear a NOISE.  They hide behi

Butlers walk past in military file, carrying elaborate di lobster and meats.  Steed steals -- A chicken leg.  Nibbles on it.  Suddenly another door ope hides.  Steed looks up to see -- Father "staring" at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma in hiding, listens as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disobeyed an order, Steed.   Mrs. Peel is dangerous; she cannot  be trusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma looks out the window behind her; eyes widen ... back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she can. (beat) Can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is deeply affected by Steed's choice. Father's face, meantime, has turned to stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall summon security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, almost walks into the door as she slips away. Emma returns as the ALARM is raised --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news. Father's looking for you.   Where are those bloody ministers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads him to the window:  sure enough -- heavy snow. Steed reacts, eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost May, for heaven sake.

dialogues.speaker: 214EXT. LONDON STREETS
dialogues.text: The blizzard rages through streets -- Now impassable.  Snow drifts block roads.  White mountain start to climb up shop fronts.  And amid the sky -- Filled with snowflakes, up round the roofs, a purple clou unsuspecting troops --

dialogues.speaker: 215INT. PALACE
dialogues.text: Steed returns, rushes across the marble halls -- To Emma. But up ahead, sees --

dialogues.speaker: FROM WINDOWS
dialogues.text: A purple fog seeping into the hallway, billowing through as --

dialogues.speaker: 217INT. PALACE ANTEROOM
dialogues.text: Inside an anteroom, like a Roman arena -- marble pillars, golden walls, ceiling murals -- The World Council ministers assemble:  slick pin-striped African robes, Chinese Mao-suits, Indian Nehru-jackets, a distinguished men and women, surrounded by -- Fussing officials, minor dignitaries, and butlers, bowing web of diplomatic protocol, interrupted by --

dialogues.speaker: 218CENTER OF HALL
dialogues.text: The sight of Emma Peel in black leather. She strides into the room.  Picks a glass of champagne fr butler.  All stare, Emma raises her glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, ladies. Forgive the breach  of protocol. An emergency --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the hallway -- BOOM -- !  The door bursts open, Emma by the blast as the purple cloud races inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the smoke furls around the ministers, they choke, fall From the doors -- Steed leaps in, gives Emma another snor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick --it'll protect you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma inhales.  Now immune to the gas, Steed and Emma hear They see -- through thick cloud -a mysterious man in a wh wearing a gas mask, leading a group of butlers, all in ga heads like black flies -- in formation round the minister the floor.  A kidnapping -- The man and butlers haul away several ministers, and -- Escape from the rear doors.  The butlers form a guard to man. Steed and Emma run after them.  More butlers pursue.

dialogues.speaker: 220EXT. PALACE
dialogues.text: As troops roll helplessly in the snow-covered purple haze load the ministers onto waiting choppers as --

dialogues.speaker: 221INT. MOTHER'S HQ
dialogues.text: Mother, Brenda, et al choke on purple smoke in the bus ..

dialogues.speaker: 222INT. PALACE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Behind pillars, Steed and Emma hide as -- Butlers in gas masks patrol the halls.  A butler passes t noticing.  They try to emerge.  But another patrols -- Steed trips the butler with his umbrella, then chops him ground.  He rises but Emma kicks him into as -- Behind them Steed sees the lab-coated man escape up the s protected by a posse of butlers.  He shouts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After him, Mrs. Peel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whole posse of butlers then advances.  Steed faces them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma hesitates.  Then turns, heads for an ornate dual sha She bangs the button, gets inside, doors shut, as the BUL MACHINE-GUNNING gas-masked butlers strike the brass door Steed whips his rapier from his umbrella and duels with t To give Emma time, he uses every trick and prop at his di brute force to -- Kick, chop, punch, and impale them into submission, as --

dialogues.speaker: 223EXT. ELEVATOR, (UPPER FLOORS)
dialogues.text: The posse of butlers fan out on to keep pace with Emma. upstairs, pressing elevator "CALL" buttons on every floor

dialogues.speaker: 224INSIDE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Emma waits inside.  Until she reaches --

dialogues.speaker: 225EXT. ELEVATOR, (2ND FLOOR)
dialogues.text: Doors open.  A HAIL of BULLETS hit the lift as Emma hides until the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: 226INT. ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Emma sighs with relief.  COOL HUM as the ELEVATOR rises.

dialogues.speaker: 227ON STAIRS
dialogues.text: Steed gaining on the butlers, heading for the stairs, as

dialogues.speaker: 228INT. ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: At the next floor, the doors open -- Two butlers rush inside.  BLAM -- !  Emma cuts one in the an elbow punch, then -- Punches -- kicks -- stabs the other butler, a more brutis recovers enough to grab Emma by the throat. She chokes, breaks his stranglehold, swerves him round, g hold on his arms and throat -- And a knee in his back in time for -- PING!  The BELL RINGS at -- 3rd floor where -- Emma spins her captive butler round, in time to face -- Whooomph!  a blast of fire from -- A flamethrower launched in the hall. Aaargh -- !  The butler gets fried, but --

dialogues.speaker: 229EXT. ELEVATOR, (3RD FLOOR)
dialogues.text: Shields Emma from the worst of the blast. She  hurls him doors, which --

dialogues.speaker: 230INT. ELEVATORS
dialogues.text: Slam shut.  COOL HUM ...

dialogues.speaker: 231EXT. PALACE MAIN FLOOR
dialogues.text: Steed continues his one-sided duel with the other butlers madly, trying to get upstairs to help Emma...

dialogues.speaker: 232INT. ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Up Emma goes.  Looks for an escape route.  Bangs on the w doors.  No secret panels.  The "floor" light flickers bet Waiting, until ...

dialogues.speaker: 233EXT. ELEVATOR, (4TH FLOOR)
dialogues.text: The doors open.  A grenade is hurled inside the doors, it corner, Emma dives to the other side, then -- Scrambles for the grenade.  Picks it up.  It slips out of Scrambles more.  It slips out ... Just beyond the elevator doors.  Which start to shut.  Em foot, kicks the grenade towards the butlers, and -- As her elevator doors close -- BOOM -- !  It EXPLODES among the butlers, one of whom -- Rushes to --

dialogues.speaker: 234ELEVATOR, (5TH FLOOR)
