dialogues.text: Where he waits for the elevator.  Removes pin.  Grenade r light PINGS. Doors open.  About to throw it inside, when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Emma.

dialogues.speaker: 236BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The butler hesitates.  Looks inside.  Still no Emma?  He to do, and -- The doors shut; he jams his foot.  The doors open again.

dialogues.speaker: 237INT. ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: -- and looks round.  Nobody there.  Until, as we -- PULL BACK UP to reveal -- FROM ABOVE, spread-eagled like elevator roof, limbs flexed against the walls is -- Emma, who -- drops down and -- Scissors the butler's head between her legs. The grenade rolls free ... Emma twists around, grabs his ears, and -- Sits on his face.  Buries his head in her crotch.  A muff the guy, until -- Emma scissor kicks, breaking his neck.  She drags --

dialogues.speaker: 238EXT. ELEVATOR, (67H FLOOR)
dialogues.text: His head out.  Leaving his neck between the doors.  So as out, heads up for the stairs, the elevators doors. SLAM! And -- BOOM!  His GRENADE rocks the elevator, which

dialogues.speaker: 239INT. ELEVATOR SHAFT
dialogues.text: Breaks from its ropes, and -- Plummets down the elevator shaft, shaking the building as

dialogues.speaker: 240INT. PALACE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Everything shakes with the impact of the elevator as Stee way up, step by step, throwing gas-masked butlers over hi he struggles...

dialogues.speaker: 241INT. PALACE ATTIC
dialogues.text: Up the winding staircase, at the top, a skylight, which - Flips open.  The man leaps out, throwing back inside a sm and locks the skylight.  As the grenade --

dialogues.speaker: 242INT. NARROW STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: BOOM!  explodes in the narrow staircase, fills it with pu Emma rushes thru smoke, choking.  She gets to the skyligh open it -- locked. A moment's panic.  Then Emma -- punches a hole in the gla switch, flips the skylight up, and -- Emerges into the night air.  Snowflakes tumble around her

dialogues.speaker: 243EXT. ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Blades whirling.  Amid the blizzard, the man ready to esc super-fab streamlined whirly chopper ... Another assassin attacks Emma, pins her on her back, over city.  Stands up before her -- Emma held back over gargoyle, over now snow white city .. assassin in balls. Flicks him backwards ... As his body hurtles down into the snow-covered streets, E forward.   But too late:  sees -- The chopper -- about to take off.

dialogues.speaker: 244FROM INSIDE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: The gas-masked MAN in the white lab coat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mrs. Peel!

dialogues.speaker: 245EXT. ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: The chopper rises slowly. Emma looks.  A fifteen foot leap ... Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: 246FROM INSIDE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: A farewell wave from the gas-masked man.

dialogues.speaker: 247CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: contemplating the jump, beneath falling snowflakes, as th grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rope/chain ladder coils into the chopper's belly.

dialogues.speaker: 249INT. CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Above London rooftops, after dark -- The man (still wears gas mask) the Pilot, CO-PILOT and a (ditto).  From the chopper, a giddy look down thru a glas module.  A fairy tale, snow white city. OVER the RADIO, interference.  A changing of stations.  T broadcast of "The Merry Widow." As the WALTZ serenades them high above the city  --  a KNOCKING from outside on the door -- Surprised reactions.  The Butler opens the door, sees -- Emma hanging onto the helicopter struts.  The Butler is t to say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts, re:  the gas mask) Anyone ever tell you you look like a housefly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma grabs his epauletted shoulder, yanks him up, flicks The Butler is jerked out -- flies into the open air.  Emm fall ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else need a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white-coated Man moves forward, but Emma is out, slam still clinging ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pilot; intercom) Can't you throw her off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot nods, works controls, the chopper dips as -- Blam -- !  a kinky leather boot crashes -- Into the Pilot's face as Emma kicks in the GLASS from the chopper, SMASHES so the Pilots can't see -- a sudden rush
The INSTRUMENT PANELS WHIRR round as the Pilots struggle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Where'd she go?

dialogues.speaker: 250EXT. CHOPPER TOP
dialogues.text: with the blades whirling directly over her head, Emma cra top of the chopper and lets herself down the other side a lights twinkle beneath ... As the Co-Pilot pokes his head out of the cockpit -- Emma grabs him with one hand, hoists him up into the air The Co-Pilot dangles over the city.  Grabs Emma.  Slither the cockpit. Pistol whips her.  Emma crunches back onto t Blades whirring close!   The co-Pilot peers into her eyes from inside the gas mask

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy landings, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his hand, ready to hit her again, Emma yanks hi his head getssliced off by the blades -- body and head fa separately ... As Emma reacts, her legs are grabbed from below and the w Man pulls her down the side of the chopper -- Emma falls, but manages a flying handhold, hangs onto the below the chopper.  As --

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The Pilot and his passenger zoom at low level over buildi to dislodge Emma ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thru the blizzard, zooming down streets, landmark buildin topped in snow, feet up ... shinnying up the chain wire . "THE MERRY WIDOW WALTZ," no longer heard as old record or arrangement but enormous, for FULL ORCHESTRA ...

dialogues.speaker: 253CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: grimly hoists herself up along the struts again, hand ove up to the cockpit from behind --

dialogues.speaker: 254BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: With a sudden movement, she yanks the Pilot out from behi flying towards eternity on his own. The chopper out of control as the white-coated Man is lef himself ...

dialogues.speaker: 255IN NIGHT AIR
dialogues.text: "THE MERRY WIDOW" BOOMS, the chopper lurches, spinning ro down, over spiraling corkscrews, an insane waltz ...

dialogues.speaker: 256INT. CHOPPER
dialogues.text: The white-coated Man gets control ...

dialogues.speaker: 257EXT. CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Zig-zags down a narrow street, trying to smash Emma into windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Emma bounces of buildings, holding on for dear life ..

dialogues.speaker: THAMES
dialogues.text: The chopper dips down, dragging Emma through icy water .. Up ahead ... Tower Bridge ... twin peaks ... a firework d on ... rockets and lights in the sky thru snowflakes ... Emma sees the bridge coming, reaches down and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detaches her pocket limpet bomb and lobs it into the chop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge looms up, chopper rising to cross it as Emma l bridge!

dialogues.speaker: 262INT. CHOPPER
dialogues.text: The Man sees the bomb ... Also flings himself onto the bridge as -- Against b.g. of the fireworks display --

dialogues.speaker: TOWER BRIDGE
dialogues.text: BOOM! -- the CHOPPER EXPLODES.  Ball of flames.  The crow appreciation ... great fireworks!

dialogues.speaker: 264EXT. TOP OF TOWER BRIDGE WALKWAY
dialogues.text: Emma picks herself up, sees the Man in the white lab coat him. He runs too -- towards --

dialogues.speaker: 265ANOTHER CHOPPER
dialogues.text: which unloads a rope ladder as Emma puts on every ounce o The Man reaches for the dangling ladder -- but --

dialogues.speaker: 266CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: stuck, wedged between narrow battlements.

dialogues.speaker: 267BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The Man looks at his shoe, at Emma charging towards him, ladder.  He pulls his foot out of his shoe and grabs the sailing off in the second chopper, leaving Emma panting behind.  She's soaked, frozen, gaspi bending over, when she sees --

dialogues.speaker: 268CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: Emma pulls it from its wedge, looks at the inside:  --  " Jermyn Street."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was Cinderella who lost her slipper ...

dialogues.speaker: 269INT. TRUBSHAW'S
dialogues.text: On Jermyn Street, snow lies waist high.  BLARING SIRENS. PA announcements urge citizens to stay indoors ... PULL B a fire glows, a CLOCK TICKS calmly.  Emma sits with her s surrounded by a pile of shoes.  Steed & Trubshaw beside h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time the shoe's on the other foot. You said a hand-made shoe was as good as a photo-fit or D.N.A.? Well, all we have to do is find the shoe that fits ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be easy. A Trubshaw client has his shoes delivered personally. The Ministry should be able to confirm our delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laying in supplies, Mrs. Peel weather  may get very nasty and I've no umbrella ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needn't bother. I can't drag you  further into this. After all, I am still  the chief suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bother. Mother and Father think I've joined you. I might as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comes back) Oh, and by the way, I think it's about  time you got rid of that chip on your  shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd been through what I have, you wouldn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed reaches and pulls off the micro-bug from her should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A microtag. One of Mother's little toys. There you are. Free at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tips his bowler off her surprised reaction.

dialogues.speaker: 270INT. TRUBSHAW'S BASEMENT
dialogues.text: An armory.  Steed stands before racks of umbrellas, displ ceremonial swords -- ivory handles, duck handles, you nam Steed hefts a few, as picky as a Samurai ...

dialogues.speaker: 271UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Emma surrounded by a mountain of shoes.  Triumphantly, sh pair of shoe lasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming, I presume. Your name is ...

dialogues.speaker: 272CLOSE ON WORN PAPER LABEL
dialogues.text: with the name:  DARLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God ...

dialogues.speaker: 273INT. TRUBSHAW'S
dialogues.text: Steed selects his umbrella and we FOLLOW UP TO:

dialogues.speaker: 274INT. TRUBSHAW'S
dialogues.text: He sees only Trubshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just left, sir. In a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said you'd understand.

dialogues.speaker: 275ON STEED
dialogues.text: Worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, here we are ...

dialogues.speaker: 276CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: WIDEN to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: 277INT. MINISTRY ARCHIVES
dialogues.text: Inside the archives, among leather volumes.  A file goes air, passed to Emma ... As she reads.  A map is opened ac from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'X' marks the spot. The shoes were  delivered to ... an island in Hyde Park. Surrounded by the Serpentine. On the  site of a former Ministry installation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Privately owned by ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess:  Wonderland Weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall need a small plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not venturing alone, surely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find out who killed my husband. Will you take these documents to Steed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I said ... goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: 279INT. SECRET SERVICE HQ
dialogues.text: below the Thames as at the beginning. In darkest paranoia, Mother lies at the heart of his Laby Controls around him flash emergency.  Panic.  Cakes piled him, uneaten.  Beside him, Father. Brenda hands a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother grabs the phone, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signals frantically for Father to trace the call, but Father just sits there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I was hoping you could tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting yourself into terrible  trouble, my son. Weather's turning  very nasty -- and so am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I'm going to follow up on a hunch of  my own. If I'm right, Mrs. Peel is  innocent and you have a mole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs mirror; searches his face) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) In your operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm warning you for the last time,  Steed: whoever's behind all this,  looks like Mrs. Peel, walks like  Mrs. Peel and kills like Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK.  The line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: 280CLOSE ON MOTHER
dialogues.text: Furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed?? (to Father) Find Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda smiles at the thought.  Father rises, grim.

dialogues.speaker: 281EXT. SKY
dialogues.text: Through mist, an ultralight plane zooms down -- From the leaps in parachute ...  Down, down, down through the mist Over parkland, the parachute floats down ... To an island of the Serpentine river.

dialogues.speaker: 282EXT. ISLAND, (HYDE PARK)
dialogues.text: Emma lands, buries her parachute.  Walks towards a thick stream.  Emma hops across on water lilies until she reach Where a peacock fans its tail of a thousand eyes.  A CLIC In the midst of the jungle, Emma sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red phone box.  Emma frowns in recognition; goes inside the phone. Presses "Button B", and -- The floor goes down.  Emma goes down with it, into --

dialogues.speaker: 284INT. HYDE PARK UNDERGROUND HQ
dialogues.text: Formerly a Ministry installation.  The "elevator" stops. as from a dream, Emma steps out into --

dialogues.speaker: 285LONG DARK CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: A GUARD patrols.  Emma pushes herself against a wall.  Th way to flip round, and Emma swivels into --

dialogues.speaker: 286INT. TOTALLY DARK CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The door locks behind.  Alone, Emma stands warily. From nowhere, a chilling, disembodied voice.  Intimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Mrs. Peel. You have  been a worthy opponent. You have  tracked us down. You are within an  ace of winning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite right, but we still make the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rules are made to be broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who wins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I. Together. But first you  must confront your greatest enemy. Who could that be, Mrs. Peel?   The answer is obvious ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly lights! Emma is in a hall of mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In every direction Emma turns, a thousand reflections of back at her, splintered into fragments as Emma spins, fre confused by the multiple images. Emma turns into herself -- only herself drapes arms aroun kisses her on the lips. Bad Emma -- whose eyes stare into Emma's startled ones as her mouth away, staggers back; realizes too late.  The ha lip poison.  Emma crumples to her knees as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees "herself" above her, before she -- falls unconscious

dialogues.speaker: 288EXT. COUNTRY ROADS
dialogues.text: Steed's Jag races, skids in bad weather.

dialogues.speaker: 289INT. CAR
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel Steed, his face grim, concentrates on th road.  On the seat next to him the snow shaker with littl

dialogues.speaker: 290INT. UNDERGROUND H.Q.
dialogues.text: As if in a dream, Emma awakes captive inside a bizarre ca size snow shaker. Emma "swims" in viscous air,suspended l Thru glass she sees -- A face peering in:  Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Emma in Wonderland. Welcome, Mrs. Peel. (filtered) We've been expecting you. We hope  you'll enjoy your stay with us.  Decontamination is almost complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decontamination -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've a new wardrobe. He does want you to look attractive. (beat ) He tells me you're very beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma pounds the glass in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Mrs. Peel. We're hundreds of feet below ground. The Ministry made it impregnable. No one can save you.

dialogues.speaker: 291EXT. SPIRES OF ETON COLLEGE
dialogues.text: as Steed drives towards it ...

dialogues.speaker: 292INT. UNDERGROUND HQ
dialogues.text: Bathed in candlelight.  A romantic supper for two ... A door opens, admitting -- Emma. Dressed, coiffed, super- She locks around, sees another door.  In search of escape to open it, only to reveal -- A giant rabbit -- the one we saw at the Teddy Bear meetin Emma gasps in surprise, moves back into the room as he ad removing the  head -- it's Dr. Darling!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, my dear. How lovely you look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out of the rest of his costume ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would that I could say the Same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but you haven't see the real me. Watch closely ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls at his face, which bubbles and collapses as he w her -- Emma's horrified expression, eyes widening as -- Dr. Darling turns into ... Peter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling Emma --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you ... all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. Not quite. I'm afraid you still don't see ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again he claws at his face, pulling, twisting ... Emma winces at the sight, her eyes popping out of her hea It's Valentine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: 293EXT. ETON COLLEGE
dialogues.text: beneath Gothic turrets pupils in top hats and tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I remember him quite well ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK THROUGH windows to reveal:  Steed and an OLD TE beautiful library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where he used to spend his days. We have an old photograph somewhere ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's flipping through yearbooks, then shows Steed --

dialogues.speaker: 294CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: of Valentine Peel on stage, in wizard's garb.  Made up as ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolute wizard with makeup. His favorite roll from Shakespeare. Prospero ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The Prospero Project...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... From The Tempest. A banished duke, ousted by his brother, marooned on a magic island. Who controlled the weather.

dialogues.speaker: 296CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'O Brave New World that hath such people in it.'

dialogues.speaker: 297BACK TO DINNER TABLE
dialogues.text: Emma frozen, sinks into a chair, staring ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling Emma -- yes, we:  the true  genius behind the Prospero Project ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks around the dinner table as he talks ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you died -- in the explosion ...

dialogues.speaker: 298FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Twisting the dial.  PAN UP the arm to reveal Valentine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I arranged the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slight miscalculation -- my face  was burned beyond recognition. Fortunately my research into plastics  came in handy ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Dr. Darling, Peter ... all you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unholy trinity ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands) You killed my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters. Of course I had to kill  the Teddy Bears, as well ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many cooks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spoil the majority shareholders. In  Wonderland Weather. I planned  everything, even the Ministry  recruiting you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I found you. All the clues led me here ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I planned that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disappoint me, Emma.  Can't you guess? (moves toward her) For you. It was all for you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) 'Our revels now are ended.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, Emma. They've only just begun ...

dialogues.speaker: 300INT. INVISIBLE JONES' OFFICE
dialogues.text: The phone hangs in the air -- with the smoking pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shoes were delivered to an island  in the Serpentine - former Ministry  installation ... she said to tell you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: goodbye. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said it's not goodbye yet. Listen, I'm going to need some help. In a hurry ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates supper) Think of this as your second wedding feast ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already married ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, come, you're a widow -- a most attractive widow. Now I think  of it, we'll need a bridesmaid. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes a button.  Bad Emma enters.  Tattooed Z424.  Un hostile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My latest model. A compound of  plastics and sensor chips. A big  improvement on the old X404s. The poor thing is quite fond of me.  Emma, say hello to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD EMMA HISSES, a strange mix of STATIC and FEEDBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I believe she's actually  jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine, listen to me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, bridesmaid. Now what have I left out? Oh, yes, I know: the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covers her hand) Ring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands very near her -- she's terrified -- then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How silly of me -- let me make you comfortable first ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he advances, ZOOM IN EXTREME CLOSEUP Emma's eye

dialogues.speaker: 303INT. ISLAND, (HYDE PARK)
dialogues.text: Another ball, WIDEN to reveal, from the lake, an odd eigh plastic ball emerges -- The ball lands on the shore.  Fro a zip peels away the plastic layer to reveal -- Steed, like an urban dandy in suit and bowler.  A rose in He steps out, and, poking with his umbrella -- Deflates the inflatable plastic submarine.  Steed heads o EYES the peacock swivel towards him, as he heads into the he sees the --

dialogues.speaker: 304RED PHONEBOX
dialogues.text: Steed picks up the phone.  Presses all the buttons until "Button B."  As the floor lowers, his eyes widen in surpr

dialogues.speaker: 305SARCOPHAGUS
dialogues.text: carved in Emma's likeness.  Lowered from the ceiling hydr

dialogues.speaker: 306INT. VALENTINE'S HIGH-TECH TORTURE CHAMBER
dialogues.text: as Valentine descends spiral steps to join it. Valentine opens the coffin to reveal Emma strapped within

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. I say, isn't this  where you came in? It's impenetrable, by the way ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entirely. On the other hand (he advances towards her, smiling) Mad people get things done. Let me show you --

dialogues.speaker: 307INT. UNDERGROUND H.Q.
dialogues.text: Steed stealing down a corridor and -- hides, as a posse of guards rushes past, alerted by the p cameras.  He waits till they pass, then reaches out his u
Nabs Father around the neck who was feeling her way after her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You reek of Mrs. Peel's Black Leather ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you who gave Valentine Peel his security clearance ... you're the mole who betrayed the Ministry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother betrayed me. She was  going to replace me with a younger  Father.  Errand boy that's all I was.   'Find Steed...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you found me. Have a sniff of  this, why don't you? Careful, the  scent can be overpowering ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding Father securely, Steed forces her nose into his r boutonniere, squeezes the rubber tube, sprays a Mist.  Fa out.  Steed rises, locks around. Sees -- A grille and removes it, climbs in and replaces it before return.  He turns  and --

dialogues.speaker: 308INT. DUCTS
dialogues.text: crawls forward through a mass of wires and plumbing -- until he hears a VOICE -- VALENTINE'S. Steed reaches another grille, through which he can see --

dialogues.speaker: 309INT. TORTURE CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Emma's coffin, standing on end, like the Iron Maiden face monitors as Valentine explains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People expect weather to be free.  They're used to it. I call that a  denial of freedom. No freedom of  choice. An abuse of human rights.  They buy water, electricity, gas.  Why shouldn't they be able to buy  their own weather if they want to?  If they have a little incentive ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma reacts -- also Steed (unseen) behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destruction of their local weather  systems. I can zap a thousand  Chernobyls into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The result would be ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Transport paralysis. Crop  failure.  Economic disaster.   Frostbite or sunburn ... on a  massive scale.  You've seen a few samples...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's stopping you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One very small thing. A diamond 'cyclone' chip. A thousand times more information on a fraction of the size. If I possess that, my powers would be unlimited. My dear half-brother was developing it. But he suspected sabotage. He gave the chip to ... you, 'Mrs.' Peel. I want you. But also your ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine takes her by the hand. Kisses --

dialogues.speaker: 310CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: A diamond.  In the light, a patterned imprint.  ZOOM IN - fractal equation of circuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missing piece of the jigsaw. I tried to get you to give it to me  as Peter; I tried to steal it from  you as Dr. Darling. As myself I'll  be a bit less subtle. (he slips it off her finger; holds it up) With this ring my plan will be complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How Wagnerian ... Do you mean  to say you've waited all these  years because you couldn't create  a chip on your own? That would  have amused Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of Peter, there's more good  news: You won't even have to change  your last name. You'll always be Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are my choices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never marry you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine is philosophical.  He spins the sarcophagus on it flat -- Emma  lying in her coffin as he looks down at her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One out of two isn't bad. I'll keep you  alive, darling Emma. In a year or five,  you may change your mind. If you're  still in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine presses a button.  From the ceiling -- a surgic Moves down to within inches of her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little toy gave me back my face. It can replace yours. What do you think? Medusa? Madame Defarge? Maggie Thatcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He marks an imaginary line round Emma's face. An ALARM BELL RINGS.  Emma reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Darling, this is Father. We have an intruder. I repeat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine switches off the PA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. That will be Steed. He followed  you. Please excuse me. I have work  to do. My most spectacular  performance. A ballet of clouds. It  was made for you. I want to give you  a heart, Emma. I want all of London  to see it. And now with this ... (flourishes ring) They will. (leans close) And for an encore: the biggest cyclone  in history will wipe the City from the  face of the earth. (winks) Shape of things to come, my darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stuffs a gag into Emma's mouth and closes the coffin o protests.  Darkness. Immediately, Steed tries to force his way through the gri luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blast. What to do? Mrs. Peel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't dare say her name too loud -- and there's no t could hear him in that thing, anyway. He turns around in the tunnel -- heads the other way.

dialogues.speaker: 312EXT. SKY OVER LONDON
dialogues.text: Moonlight night.  Dark clouds approach like an army, spre

dialogues.speaker: 313INSIDE CLOUDS
dialogues.text: MOISTURE SPITS and CRACKLES, static energy waiting to exp In the sky -- clouds join together like a genie from a la over the city -- a strange dark sensuous figure, half hum dreamlike. That stalks the city....

dialogues.speaker: 314INT. DUCTS
dialogues.text: Steed crawling.  A rat runs over him ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things I do for England ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch dark, then -- Emma's coffin is opened and we see Bad Emma, looking down Bad Emma stares at her human double -- Emma: who looks im her to undo the gag.  Bad Emma removes it, she -- Runs a finger down Emma's body, inside a hole torn in the warm human flesh. Blood.  Her flesh.  Her blood.  Fascina

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must let me go ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Emma listens.  Gently lays her head on Emma's breast, the HEARTBEAT.  Ba-boom.  Ba-boom ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? If he has me, he'll have no use for you ... he'll destroy you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words jolt Bad Emma back, remembering her mission.  S laser, aims it at Emma's face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Emma hesitates, looks strangely human as -- 315ANOTHER PART OF UNDERGROUND H.Q. The grille pops off and Steed emerges where the guards ar him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No escape.  He takes off his bowler -- deftly removes a s brim, aims it at the guards, and -- Hurls it ...

dialogues.speaker: 316CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: A glinting razor's edge, which -- Swoosh -- !  Slices into the closest guard before returni boomerang to Steed. He taps twice hard steel as ...

dialogues.speaker: 317OTHER GUARDS
dialogues.text: run towards him, Steed swivels gracefully and - slams the their faces, a sartorial knuckleduster -- wham -- !  One - !  The other collapses, slump to the ground.  Steed sto picks up his hat, sees -- A dent in its steel top.  For the first time, Steed loses Genuine rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's going to pay for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping over the nearest body, Steed moves on his way, a

dialogues.speaker: 318CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: places a ring inside a control module filled with identic diamond chips ... WIDEN to reveal ...

dialogues.speaker: 319INT. CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Masses of dials and switches.  ( Off to one side, on a wa rapiers ... ) Valentine hits a switch ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the countdown. Action stations. Five minutes ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The countdown starts, red digitals going backwards -- Colorized computer screens map out hostile weather fronts A COMPUTERIZED VOICE STARTS to COUNT.  The CLOCK TICKS. Father enters behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. The clouds are on course ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To explode. London will be ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
